# Overview

Content to start with. Update workstations if needed (devtools?).

## Formatting data for efficient analysis

Reformatting your data into a "tidy" format is a useful practice and allows you efficiently manipulate and analyze data sets. We will start with some toy examples (using the `anscombe` data set) and then will reformat a commonly used data type from a quantitative PCR experiment.

- columns are variables
- rows are observations
- related data should be stored in separate tables
